website_summaries.verdict: Style meets technology in this beautifully designed smart watch.
pros: The large watch face and beautiful leather wrist band give the look and feel of a normal watch
The Pro model is compatible with Google Pay
There are 2 screens and 2 modes that you can easily switch between for extended battery life
Voice commands are easily picked up and work with great accuracy
The large watch face makes reading messages easier
The watch can be worn in the shower as well
GPS is accurate enough to order an Uber straight from your watch
cons: The watch is a little heavy, takes some getting used to

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible experience, forces you to hand all of your personal data over to the Chinese company Mobvoi in order to get basic functionality. It disables WearOS features until you give the Mobvoi app every permission it requests. Wish I could get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great smart watch, minus death after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I love the hardware, and WearOS. NFC payment is cool. Super easy to set up and charge. Beats my FitBit Blaze easily, in the area of phone/watch integration, style, customization, and responsiveness. HOWEVER, it lasted 2 weeks. It won't indicate it is charging, and it will not 'power on'. I was charging normally, as I have previously, but it stopped working completely during the charge. I will update my review if I can get a replacement easily. I feel bad because I really liked this watch.. hopefully mine was just a defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: E1ris

customer_reviews.title: DOA ... Twice
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this watch - great spec's, attractive, and an always on screen like what was on my Sony Smartwatch 2 around 6 years ago. However, both copies I have received failed during installation - they got stuck on the "gather data about your watch" screen. No problems reinstalling my Moto 360 which I'd disabled, so it's obviously something wrong with the Ticwatch. Until / unless they work out the problems, I heartily recommend that you NOT buy this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Paulbo

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working a day after I could send back to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Seemed good at first and then it just stopped working. I was out of town and it was working one second and then poof....nothing. I called support and just got the run around. Apparently they can't help with anything on the phone and you have to submit an online ticket. Been waiting on that response for a while. At this point I just flushed $250
customer_reviews.author: duner

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality watch but with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: A quality watch running Wear OS. The controls are logical and easy to use. The dual screen does help with battery life but I had issues with the HRM displaying on the second screen. The band is easy changed with a standard 22mm band. The band that comes with the watch is small for larger wrists. If your wrist is larger than 7.5” you will most likely need to purchase and use a different band. The charging dock is proprietary with a short cable. At this time you cannot buy a replacement charging dock, a HUGE negative. If you break it or it fails your watch is useless. Maybe in the near future they will sell them as an accessory.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Not Supported by Mobvoi
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my son for Christmas. He loved it, however after having it for just 4 months it stopped working. He tried multiple chargers but it would not charger or turn on. He put in a support case with the manufacturer Mobvoi. The would not communicate with him at all. They just mailed him a new charger, which didn't work to charge the watch. When he tried to update his support case, he found that Mobvio had just closed the case. Mobvio did not check in to see if their solution worked. Buyer beware. It was a great watch, but if it stops working, Mobvio will not support you.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Dead - never turned on
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, and it doesn't turn on. I tried charging in multiple USB outlets for one or two hours, and while the watch does get hot, it still doesn't light up the screen. When I'm pressing on the crown very long time the watch vibrates for a split second, but still nothing. Complete waste of time & money. .
customer_reviews.author: Kiroa

customer_reviews.title: Well, I returned it so.
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is an updated review of this watch. I bought it about a month ago, but now I have returned it and let me tell you why. Is the watch good? Yes, it is. However, there are some problems with it. I was fed up with how glitchy and slow it could be from time to time. The processor in it is already ancient, so I don't know why they didn't update it since this watch was just released. Another problem is that I could never get it to sync to my phone every day. I would always have to reset it and then it would connect. After all that I was just tired of it.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Some how this watch discharges itself and will not recharge
customer_reviews.text: I have had it with this watch. People who reviewed this watch posted that the watch will not charge the first time and showed a battery icon which was right. I had a difficult time getting this watch to charge and having it for six months it is ready for the garbage. It is really frustrating with this watch. One has to attach the charger and press down where it connects to make contact to charge and if left on the charger it will discharge itself and you head ache starts continually pressing the buttons and the watch to the charger until it turns on to charge. This watch is a headache and a piece of sh**t
customer_reviews.author: Oldpville

customer_reviews.title: Technical Support for my Tic Watch Pro
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my watch about a year ago. Lately, having a hard time charging and keeping the watch charged so I reached out to the support area of the company. They were responsive; offered several solutions. When they didn't work, they sent me a new watch charger which solved my problem. They also offered to replace the watch if the last solution didn't work. I really do like the watch, its features etc. I like it even more because the company stands behind its products. I will gladly buy another Tic Watch Pro when I'm ready to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. Calabrese

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: At first my husband and I were in aw because the watch is gorgeous and when working, seems pretty amazing. However, day 1 we were unable to use the watch to talk over the phone. At the end of the day we put the watch to charge and since then all we get is a lightning bolt sign and then it turns off. We charged it for 8 hours and nothing. I will be returning and searching for a new watch. Very disappointed. Hopefully this one was just defective and they are not all like that. 2 months later. Second watch stopped working. Claim process a mission. Do not buy it’s a piece of garbage
customer_reviews.author: Joahanna

customer_reviews.title: Has A Long Way To Go
customer_reviews.text: I have a Gear S3. As a Deputy Sheriff I receive many text messages during the day while in my vehicle. I use the voice to text feature quite a bit and believe me, the S3 leaves a lot to be desired in that area. I decided to give the Ticwatch Pro a try for access to Google Assistant. It worked flawlessly, but the other function on the watch leave a lot to be desired. I downloaded some watch faces that just did not work, and the lag issue with the slow processor in the watch is frustrating. Also the Wear OS app and the Mobvoi app leave a lot to be desired also. I have returned the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Bundy

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this watch
customer_reviews.text: It arrived very quickly, as described & packaged well. My son loves it, it tracks his steps, connects to his phone so he can see who calls/texts & he can even respond on it. The battery seems to lasts long & it has a wireless charger which is nice. He changes the clock face all the time, depending on his mood or what he's into at the moment. He's had it about a month, wears it all the time, (even at work where he has a pretty physical job) & so far there haven't been any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Laura E.

customer_reviews.title: Watch Is just not as described
customer_reviews.text: The watches are sold with a promise of 2-days on battery when using all its capabilities, 2-weeks in the power saving mode. The watch was 65% discharged after less than 16 hours. The features on the watch work OK but the sleep tracking does not work at all. The alarm function on the watch was a pain in the butt. The first day I had to power down the watch to get it to turn off? Must have hit something wrong on the watch. just not a good watch from my point of view.
customer_reviews.author: CSMO1964

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate heart/fitness monitor. Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to be good. The OS Wear is a lot of fun and there are some useful apps there. I enjoyed having Google Maps, my notifications etc on my wrist. The heart monitor works ok if you're sitting, but is hopeless on walks it at the gym. I was going for a mild walk and it said I had "dangerous" level of 180bpm. My pulse was 80! Then I took it to the gym for my usual workout. They gym machine said 120bpm for 30 minutes. My watch said I only reached exercise level for 2 minutes. This level of inaccracy is hopeless so I returned it or a refund. Does not perform as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: L A O

customer_reviews.title: A smart watch without the battery anxiety
customer_reviews.text: With pretty light use (basically to check notifications and use google assistant) I am getting about 2 days of battery out of the watch. I don't know where they get that 5 day estimate from, but that seems very generous to me. The huge upside of this watch is the second display, when your watch reaches a set percentage it turns into a regular watch. So even your smartwatch dies, you still have a functioning watch on your arm that is measuring heart-rate. For something that seems so gimmicky, it is actually incredibly helpful! The materials and built quality are on par with a Samsung device, but it does have some little nooks and crannies that attract sweat and dirt.
customer_reviews.author: h steenstrup

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE Google Fit Users
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a perfect watch if I could swap from their "Tic Health" to Google Fit. The "swipe left" menu is permanently set to their "Tic Health" app. While you can still use Google Fit, it is buried in the apps menu. Or you could bind it to a button.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Taylor

customer_reviews.title: google assistant on google os....all you need to know....love watch
customer_reviews.text: recommend buying stand charger and using 1.5 or 2 amp ps ....recharges super fast... you'll need to connect to your google account for calendar and contacts but after that, watch does what phone used too....nothing like asking your watch a question and getting answer spoken back to you....or let your watch direct you home while driving !!! apps in play store are hit miss...some i use are flashlight,stay lit wear ,my location,my radar,maps, calendar,sleep tracking for starting app on phone at bed time !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great. Never having had a smart watch before I wasn't sure what to expect, but this has quickly become a part of my daily routine. I got this and the new Galaxy watch not sure what would work for me. But the integration with Google products sealed the deal for me. Not to mention it was $100 cheaper. If you are invested in the Android eco system and not tied to Samsung's apps this is great. This watch just works. I will definitely be watching to see what this company brings out in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Premium Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: If you have the money for a nicer smartwatch, this is probably the one for you. The battery life doesn't seem to be quite as great as advertised, but it is definitely better than the competition. I'm a military guy, so I bought this watch for the GPS feature, long battery life, and the nerd aspects. Pros: Great feel to the watch band. This simply feels like a premium watch. Multiple apps on the Google Play store (10 digit grids, accurate compass). Very fast charging. Cons: It isn't cheap, but you get what you pay for Smartwatch technology is still new. Growing pains. Only two buttons. A third would make for better quick access without being too much.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S

customer_reviews.title: Loved this watch until.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch in Oct. 2018. It was my first smart watch. Love it! Easy to learn! Lots of compliments! This would still be a great watch if it would charge. Last weekend it stopped charging and I can no longer use it. Because of the time frame, Amazon can not help. I'm hoping to get in touch with Movbi tomorrow. I'm hoping they will be able to help. I am so disappointed. Edit: Mobvoi customer service is fabulous! Helped me navigate the online form and received a new charger within days. Watch is working great! I'll always buy from Mobvoi and Tic watch.
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: Great watch don't judge battery on first 24 hours!!!
customer_reviews.text: Revised Review customer service got hold of me and helped a lot I have got another watch and it works perfect the 2 screen design is one of the best ideas I have seen in watch. Problems with Google wear should be fixed with the new 3.0 update coming from Google. I've learned don't judge battery based on first day all those apps being downloaded and updated will kill any battery. After that I am currently on day 4 on one charge and 37% left. One last thing the watch band that comes with watch is great leather in outside silicone on inside I can do my work out don't have to worry about sweat meeting up the leather.
customer_reviews.author: The Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: I wish someone would do some long term testing on these watches. Everyone rates the ticwatch pro highly but mine started acting up after a month or so (even after multiple resets). It freezes all the time and doesn't respond to commands quickly. Right now it doesn't even charge all the way, sometimes it does sometimes it doesn't. I'll have it charging all night and when I look at it in the morning it will have 34% charge or something like that. And this is with a different charger since the charger it came with doesn't charge the watch at all. Not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M

customer_reviews.title: $250 a year watch BS.
customer_reviews.text: I spent basically $250 on this last August here it is November and the watch is not charging. The warranty was for 12 months plus they offered a 6 month addition if I received emails from them. They claim I'm out of the warranty period it is very expensive, offered me a 30% discount to buy a new one. If the charger is bad they are out of them. Never used the sleep tracker I usually was down to 30% by nights end. Not happy loved it better than moto 360 while it worked. should not have a failure after 13 months.
customer_reviews.author: Austen Schrader

customer_reviews.title: This product has failed me
customer_reviews.text: Did a review when I purchased this about six months ago and thought it offered the best option for a Android product. It was a good looking watch and for the first five months it has performed pretty well. Then I ran into charging issues. First I thought it was the chargers, I had three of them, but sound found it to be the watch itself. It just stopped charging or would take forever to even get to 10%. I just could not count on it to function and stopped using it. I have reached out to the manufacturer over a week ago and still have not received a response.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B

customer_reviews.title: Bait and Switch Advertising - UNETHICAL
customer_reviews.text: I was directed to this watch via an article I received in my news feed about these watches being upgraded to 1 GB of memory. Went to the Amazon site and sure enough, it stated 1 GB RAM. I bought it and frankly am happy with the watch from a battery consumption perspective, but when I started noticing some sluggish performance I began to question if I got the watch I thought I purchased. Sure enough, the 1 GB description is now gone and there is nowhere on the site to even see what the RAM configuration is. So I pulled out the users manual and sure enough...512 MB RAM. TOTALLY UNETHICAL and UNACCEPTABLE. Returning now.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Tic Watch should NOT be underestimated!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The essential mode is so useful, it will dramatically extend battery life if you are gone for a few days. It will still count steps, and and hearbeat monitor. Turned on with full features it still lasts about 3 days. It is Well Built metal and glass and will not disappoint. The band is also more comfortable than typical silicone bands. Packed with features a full Wear OS watch!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless fitness tracker, if it works at all
customer_reviews.text: My first unit was DOA. It wouldn't charge. This led to some research which uncovered this watch had a lot of charging issues. My replacement came in two days later, and the user interface was painfully slow and unresponsive. I put it on my wrist alongside my Fitbit Charge HR and set off to walk 100 paces. The Fitbit registered 97 steps... Not bad! The Ticwatch only registered 64 steps. Between the painfully unresponsive UI and inaccurate fitness tracking, this was not the watch I was looking for and returned it the next day
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes - and was let down.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about this watch. I was expecting such good battery life. This watch doesn't have any better battery life than any smartwatch I've ever owned. Unless you're in the essential mode, which doesn't have a backlight and is hard to see unless in a well lit area. And this watch is laggy. Worse than my old Pebble and Asus watches from years ago. It looks nice, build quality is great. I wanted to keep it but just got too frustrated. Even shutting off the screen and only turning it on to check the time I could barely get a day's use from a charge. And enabling developer mode to close running apps didn't help either. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Expect it to last about 10 months before failing completely
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first ticwatch due to the good reviews, but 10 months later, the watch would no longer charge... This is a common issue if you google around. So, they replaced with a new watch, which, 10 months later has the same issue. Since this replacement watch was actually new and came from Amazon, I inquired about a warranty, but they stated the best they can do is a 30% discount off a new purchase. Why would I want to buy another piece of junk that will die?
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch, Only Charging Issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought a watch directly from Mobvoi and one on amazon for my brother in law. I haven't heard much from him yet, but I love the watch. I have had two Samsung watches in the past and must say this watch is equal or better to the samsung. Love the dual layer face to see the time at all times and the quickness of the watch. The one issue is the charging of the watch. I have issues with the watch connecting to the charger and have to connect and reconnect multiple times some days to get it to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Crm0404

customer_reviews.title: Pissed off.
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered the ticwatch pro Lte version. However I received the pro premium version of ticwatch. The ticwatch pro premium is junk, it's super slow, not much memory, and battery is super junk and freezes all the time. Nothing works like they claim. The ticwatch pro Lte at least has more memory and with wear is that makes a huge difference. So I asked for a replacement and guess what, they are shipping the same Damm junk watch. Now got to return both junk watches before my card gets refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable product - confused help and service
customer_reviews.text: This watch died after less than two weeks. The number given on the oniine support site for warranty service is no longer in service! I am still struggling to find out how to get it repaired or a return done. I would not buy this product again if I had known how poor the service would be. I guess you have to feel lucky to buy this watch. Buyer beware! .. as an addendum to this post I must note that I did get a replacement watch that works well.
customer_reviews.author: James A

customer_reviews.title: still going strong after 13 months
customer_reviews.text: I really love the watch. I have been wearing it everyday for more than a year now. It does everything I want it to. The case and crystal are supper durable. I have zero marks on it after a year. My only issue is that it gets a little sluggish from time to time. I have read reviews that said the new version with double the ram fixes that issue. Not sure it would be worth $300 for the upgrade but if I were looking for a new watch I would go for the 4g model. That being said, this model has been very reliable, looks great and is fun to have.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Ticwatch Pro 3 days ago. First off, I'm very impressed with the build quality and features of the smart watch. If works very well and is a joy to wear. When I purchased my watch, I saw the promotion for a free ticband if I bought the watch. I must have not followed the instructions on how to get the Ticband for free. I contacted Ticband customer service about this and they offered to send me a free Ticband. Now that's what I call customer service! This type of service will be making me a long time customer and a person that will be singing their praise to others. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Really liked it... for the 5 weeks it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice watch, but after five weeks, the screen just blinks and the buttons/watch face are unresponsive. Past the Amazon return window so I have gone to Mobvoi for support, and it's a pain: they are supposedly sending me a shipping label, so I can ship it back, and then they will send me another, so figure a couple of weeks. In terms of features and functions it's great but needless to say this return experience would keep me from recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: Woolfhound

customer_reviews.title: Both quality, value and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Moto 360 Gen2 smart watch which was terrible. Needed to be rebooted daily and then company stopped the updates. The Ticwatch Pro is a very good watch. Easy to activate and works great. I have the always on function and high brightness and the battery lasts almost 2 days before switching to the LCD battery saver screen. I did have a problem when my watch stopped charging. However, i contacted the Mobvoi Team who responded very quickly and sent me a new charging dock indicating if that didn't fix the problem they would send me a replacement watch. Fantastic customer service .
customer_reviews.author: Mirror3

customer_reviews.title: Best value in smartwatch for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. IMO it looks so much better than the Apple watch because it's round. I owned a few so called smart watches before starting at Pebble when it was new and later getting an Amazefit Bip. They were nice but obviously this watch blows them out of the water. So far I'm impressed with Google Wear too. It does everything the Apple watch can do for half the price. I get 2 days of battery time in regular mode which is ok. Reportedly it's like 30 days in essential mode but I have not tried to verify that. Overall this is a perfect 5 star purchase
customer_reviews.author: LXK

customer_reviews.title: It's a good looking watch that works great
customer_reviews.text: I use this watch as my daily driver. It does everything I ask of it good - great. I'd give it 5 stars except I think it has room for improvement around the app with regard to the number of watch faces available. Also, I don't find the software on the watch to be 5 stars. I'd give it a 3.8-star rating on comfort. It is a manly watch so that's a plus for me. Bottom line is that I'm happy with the purchase especially since I bought it around Christmas 2018 for around $180. If you can find this watch for under that you should buy it. Above $200.......maybe not given the fact, it has an older chip.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Ananda

customer_reviews.title: S L O W
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product new and straight out of the box the watch already had a chip in it! Once I finally got to using the watch, I had to do 3 factory resets on it before it would work properly. I specifically wanted a wear OS because I don't want to get caught in the samsung trap anymore than I already am. I never would have gone with wear OS if I knew it was going to be more clunky and SLOW. I spent over 6 months researching smart watches before making the decision to purchase this one. I am extremely disappointed with the speed and quality of this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Penguin

customer_reviews.title: A really great smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! After numerous other watch purchases I finally found one that works really well and I love! It connects to my phone (LG V30) without issues and reconnects as it should. I love the dual layer screen which allows the simple watch function to be visible while saving battery and then a push of the button turns on the led screen. But wonder of wonders someone finally designed a watch with a really good charging connector! I love this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works great, until it stops recharging
customer_reviews.text: I had this watch for about 6 months and over the course of 3 weeks, it went from recharging to 68%, to not recharging at all. It started out of the blue when i left it on the charger at night like i do to wake up and find it recharged to 68%. Then the next night, 40%, and each night after less and less. When I place the watch on the recharger it shows its connected and recharging, but it never does. I gave it 2 stars because when it worked, i thought it was great. But its just not a smart investment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L. Szablewski

customer_reviews.title: doesn't make sense
customer_reviews.text: sorry for breaking it for you: - battery runs out like crazy, it goes from fully charged to 50% in couple of hours given active use of the watch - in power-save (essentials) mode it's no better than a pretty dumb watch (showing no seconds) that costs $20 - so it all boils down to what you can do is: - measure your activities like pulse, steps, etc which is highly inaccurate - check text, email, slack, etc notifications off your wrist - set a alarm clock - set a timer
customer_reviews.author: ikovsky

customer_reviews.title: Bug haven
customer_reviews.text: This was my first WearOS smartwatch and it was the buggiest thing I've ever seen. Left a bad taste in my mouth. I literally had to restart the watch about once or twice a day to get some apps to work. I also had to factory reset it twice to get the GPS and HR monitor to work. The 2nd display is also hideous and makes it look like you're wearing a 5 dollar kids watch from Walmart. The only way to turn that off is AOD. I since then got myself a Fossil, and it runs alot snappier than this, and less buggy
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: looks nice with easy to use display
customer_reviews.text: A bit bigger than expected. But over all a very nice watch with a classic dial. My biggest reason for not giving more than 3 stars is that I cant get any notification on the watch via vibrations. I can see the notification on the watch but there is no indication via vibrations (using a Pixel 2 XL phone)
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Not an Apple watch.  Definitely.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Dec 2, 2019. I have been using this watch for 22 days now. An Android user for some time, I zeroed in on Wear OS for the most compatibility. I took my time choosing a watch this time, after my long gone Pebble and more recent Fitbit. Read a ton of reviews, pros and cons, battery life, sleep monitoring, notifications, Dick Tracy phone on a watch image, stinky leather straps (this one surpringly not), ... ... More to come... Christmas dinner beckoning...
customer_reviews.author: The Real Me

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts more than a day
customer_reviews.text: I've had the watch for a few weeks and have no real complaints so far. I've forgotten to charge it a few times and it still has battery life. I have to say that I somewhat preferred their proprietary operating system in their older watches to Google Wear, although I understand why they had to join the crowd in that regard. Overall I'd recommend it - it does what it's supposed to do and stays out of your way otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Xiggy

customer_reviews.title: OVERPRICED
customer_reviews.text: For someone who actually likes this product, I think this watch is way overpriced. After a few months you will see how the watch will slow down. It stats to ring late when you receive a call, the charger some how stops working, and we are talking about having the watch for only less than 6 month, the charger feels so cheap. This watch should cost about $100-$150. Other than that, I mainly use it for work. Maybe I shouldn't really on it so much because now that the charger stopped working and the customer service takes a decade to solve this issue, I will have to use my feelings to organize these classes
customer_reviews.author: yafi

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for prompt and honorable customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband this watch for Christmas last year, and he really likes it. In late August it stopped charging. I thought for sure I had flushed my money again - we've had SO many smart watches stop working or have the apps discontinued. However, I was pleasantly surprised that returning it was pretty simple! I even took quite awhile to send it back after approval because I didn't have time to get to the post office. Once I shipped it back, we received a brand new watch within a week! Really appreciate the easy replacement of a pricey item, and we are hopeful this one will hold up
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer

customer_reviews.title: NICE TICWATCH PRO
customer_reviews.text: The Ticwatch Pro is by far the best smartwatch that I have purchased. With the double face design, it is a pleasant change from the regular smartwatches and is quite different. One can alternate the time mode in terms of having a 5 day battery life as opposed to a 30 day life. Changeable watch faces underneath the first layer makes it quite unique. Has the ice features of notifications, exercise tracking, Google assistant, heart rate, etc. This is one terrific smartwatch and well worth the money. Support is great and they will help you out if you have a question. If you want something different than the other smartwatches out, try the Ticwatch Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Gopher69

customer_reviews.title: Works great! **Updated 14 months in use**
customer_reviews.text: Love it, use it mostly for notifications and the time. The battery life was great! After about 14 months or so it seemed to have less life and wasn't holding a charge. I did have the display always on with a wrist twist, which might have had the battery drain less. The power save feature is amazing though. Several more hours even on 5%!!! I had signed up for the 18th month warranty though and got a replacement within a week of sending the old one back. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Handley

customer_reviews.title: I'm much more disappointed that I thought I would be and moreso after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: The whole point of this one is that it should have a longer than average battery life, but it really doesn't. The lcd screen is barely readable. The apps are much slower to respond than my wife's Fossil smart watch. Now after 18 months the battery doesn't last through the whole day. The notifications work about half the time. It looks nice though. I don't think I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J.. Lovitt

customer_reviews.title: The battery in mine doesn't last a day!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed, wasted my money on this watch. The battery doesn't last one day without having to recharge it. It's not because I'm using all the things it has to offer, I just use the watch. Compare this to a $20 smart watch I got on Wish, it lasts 5 days on a charge and works great. I bought this because my research said that if I only used it as a watch, it could last up to 30 days, OR was that 30 hours!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bill from Jacksonville

customer_reviews.title: Good, but nowhere near the best.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box it was a very nice looking watch. Loved the contrast of the stainless steel bezel against the black matte finish lower. It's when I turned the device on that things went south. It took minutes to boot up. Once up and running, I noticed a lag in moving between apps and functions. It was really disappointing after reading about how Wear OS has improved so much as of late. I used this in sync with a Samsung Galaxy Watch for only 1 day and knew the latter was the better option for me. So I returned the Ticwatch Pro. Gokd company with fine products. Anxious to see what they launch in 2019/20.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DO NOT WASTE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it zero or -10 stars. Huge waste of money. Apps are piece of crap and watch stopped working after four months. Absolutely worst customer service. Asking for $150 to repair faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase. Highly recommended. SERIOUS BATTERY LIFE!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smartwatch. The build quality is excellent. Over the top battery life! Extremely comfortable to wear. A++! As an update to my review, I would just like to add that I've been testing how long I could go on a single charge. In essential Mode, I went 35 days before I needed to charge it again. SERIOUS BATTERY LIFE! After doing a second test of Essential Mode, with no hickups in the middle of the test, I went a full 39 days in Essential Mode. I'm seriously happy with my Ticwatch Pro!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Knight

customer_reviews.title: very good  smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm I get three days of battery life out of it and that is with both modes turned on my only regret is that unlike my previous asus smart watch it does not have a remote camera app. I have come to love this feature and use it a lot when taking pictures in places where I can't touch the screen to take the pic. but other wise its a great watch to have and use.
customer_reviews.author: Godfrey Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for a smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I don't sleep in it so I don't know about that and I seldom use the mobile app. I love the dual display. Disappointed in the battery life with downloaded faces. If I stick with a default face I get 4 days from one charge, a downloaded face lasts a little over 2 days. The charger will blow if you plug it into a charger that can supply more than 1 A. A weak link since the charger has no built in protection. I did find this noted when I went back to the documentation with a magnifying glass. The manufacturer was very quick to replace the blown charger.
customer_reviews.author: UKkid89

customer_reviews.title: The experience overall has been underwhelming with few positives
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -- Notifications -- Watch faces -- Solid construction CONS: -- Voice command interaction is practically non functional -- Hey Google always fails on the first attempt ("Can't connect to Google") -- Slow, slow, slow, slow. Wish I could emphasize this more -- Proprietary charging interface -- Battery life is the same as any other watch that I've experienced. The digital watch mode is ultimately a gimmick. For the money, this was a regretful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. W. Foley

customer_reviews.title: Great smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I really love this watch from the first day I received it from being able to using gpay, getting notifications on the go, and even tracking exercise. but I experienced a hiccup early on in the first two months that being the watch stopped charging. I found after working with the great Mobvoi team that the issue was the charger and not the watch. They quickly rectified this issue by sending me a new charger free of charge. I tried the new charger and it worked great and I am still loving this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Baldy E

customer_reviews.title: Great smartwatch that fulfills (almost) all promises...
customer_reviews.text: I like the product allot, but I am not really a heavy user. I believe it lives up to all its specification promises. However, I am a iphone user and as expected there are some limitations. the watch is basically an information interface that shows incoming calls and messages and reports your information back to the an android health-app of your choice, but I believe that is where the integration with the iPhone ends. I am sure, that this is a great device when paired with an Android device and it looks like a real watch (as opposed a metal brick) at your wrist, but if you want real integration with an iPhone the apple watch remains your only choice.
customer_reviews.author: Torsten Banze

customer_reviews.title: Great watch while it's working!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch as a Christmas present to my son. It recently stopped working. It charges and you can read the time on it, but the functions no longer work. The bevel turns as if to go to a function, but nothing comes up. Same goes for the side buttons. I can't get onto the warranty page in order to put in a claim (the link will not open for the claim to be made). A new phone was purchased and we thought everything was transferred over, but the Tic password did not (and he can't remember it). What a mess and an expensive lesson! Still trying to get with the TIC company to resolve this.
customer_reviews.author: gisela

customer_reviews.title: Has stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Update 4/14/2018: I purchased this watch in September of last year, 2018, and it has completely stopped working. It might be the charger. I will contact the seller and see what happens. I will keep you posted. This is a nice looking watch and it does what I expected. It is a quality smart watch. The leather band is not stiff and is comfortable to wear. I did't really buy it for any thing other than to change the watch face and count steps. It does those things well. I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rick the Rock

customer_reviews.title: Mostly okay
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Dec of 18. E erything has worked pretty well. The old processor does seem to lag alot. Especially when I get a call. My phone will ring 4 times before my watch will vibrate. Battery is actually pretty good as long as you don't have GPS, nfc on. One thing that pissed me off is the metal piece that goes into the watch band broke off and I had to buy another band. The original band was super annoying anyway because the little plastic piece that holds the bnd in place slides all over the damn place.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase this watch.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! Only purchase if you are looking for a $250 brick. I failed to research this product & all the charging issues people were having. Now I am having the same charging issues. This watch has been very temperamental, to the point I have stopped wearing it. Last ditch effort was getting a new charger that worked one time. Now watch won't charge at all. Mobvoi's warranty policy pretty much guarantees you will never get a refund or a new watch, as well as dodging sending you a new charging dock.
customer_reviews.author: D. Grigsby

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last 5 days under heavy daily use. . More like 2 1/2 days
customer_reviews.text: The watch is very nice. Be careful as of 8/23/18 a separate charger cannot be purchased. Cats chewed my charger and I have now officially had a $250 watch that doesnt work longer than it worked. I will say customer service although slow to send replacement charger, they have been extremely friendly and communicative. Because of liking the watch so much, and the friendly attitude, I have decided to continue using the Ticwatch Pro
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a replacement for my 2nd Gen Moto 360 and came across this watch in August when it first came out. Got this watch on Thanksgiving Day special so the price was great. The watch is holding up quite nicely. I workout a lot and it has kept up with me. I got the silver one so I can swap out the silver metal band no problem and looks great. Battery life is great and the lowest I get is around 20-25% with an all day use. We shall see on how things go but right now I am quite impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Knasinski

customer_reviews.title: Good but - Speaker issue and not good warranty
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty nifty watch and I love it for my first smart watch. I never would buy an Apple watch bc I knew I wanted to go back to Android. Of course, I am looking forward to a better processor in Android watches! Unfortunately my husband sweats a lot and apparently this must have damaged his speaker. I can hear him clearly on my end, but volume on his is ridiculously low and he's rarely used it. 30 day warranty. This happened just a few days after the return date. Go figure. So, that sucks for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Smith

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not that great.
customer_reviews.text: I get about 70% battery life from 7 in the morning when I leave for work until about 9 at night when I take it off to get ready for bed. All I use it for is to check the time and getting alerts most of the other functions I turned off to try and help battery life. But it's still the same. Over all I wouldn't recommend it. The watch is also very heavy. I'm planning on replacing it soon with a galaxy watch or something with more funtionality and battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Postma

customer_reviews.title: Works just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised that the quality of this watch exceeded my expectations. I've had it and used it since Prime Day purchase and it works great. Google Fit tracks my exercise, notifications work fine, I've taken a phone call or two on it, navigation works, even had my American Airlines boarding pass on it. Have no real complaints except I'm going to get a new watchband for it. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Wood

customer_reviews.title: Unless you have a masters degree in engineering and enjoy solving difficult puzzles, stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece of equipment but difficult to use. The software is non-intuitive in the extreme and usability for health related functions is extremely disappointing. Knowing what I know now, I would not buy. There are much better products around.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle S Lohmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life exceptional
customer_reviews.text: I don't do many reviews but with my purchase of the TicWatch Pro I had to. I came from a a "showcase" watch which I won't say the name (it had LTE though). If I was lucky it lasted half a day at best with most features turned off. Back to the TicWatch Pro, I couldn't believe how long the battery life lasted. I have all features turned on except the always on screen and I consistently see 2+ days life. It now has Wear OS 2.1 and it's even better. Mobvoi got it right and I hope they keep innovating!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Slooooowwww, vibrates randomly with no notifications, screens disappear, GPS can't get a fix
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in anticipation of using this as a fitness watch and convenience but the OS and Ticwatch bloatware keep it from performing anything other than keeping time or relaying the weather. Touch the screen for a response and it takes 5 seconds for each gesture. I am past my 30 day return window but am asking for a full refund as it took me 30 days just to try and get it working right. Have updated, re installed, etc and it is so slow it is not useful for anything but annoying you. This was my first experience with Wear OS and I don't know if it is the product, OS or what but I can certainly do without.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Rust

customer_reviews.title: God is within the little details
customer_reviews.text: Overall the Tickwatch looks good, it is made of good materials BUT: 1. Buyer should know that the only way to download music to the watch is with a valid google music account which is NOT working worldwide. 2. The quality of the support you can get from Mobvoi is VERRY POOR. 3. Battery drains much faster then promissed.
customer_reviews.author: Moshe

customer_reviews.title: It's a $200 step counter! Not much else.
customer_reviews.text: I expected a lot more from this smart watch. No sleep tracking that I could find. Can't use my weather app. Can't use Hangouts and the list goes on. Super slow and laggy, battery life not that great. Watch body is plastic and just feels cheap. I watched several YouTube videos on this and was sucked in by the hype. Just plain boring. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking watch, has a good heavy feel to it due to its metal construction. Specs wise it falls in line with everything on the market at the time of release. What sets this aside is the dual display along with some features that you would expect in high end smart watches. Nfc, GPS, heart rate monitor all come on this thing. I definitely recommend this watch to anyone looking to buy a smart watch.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Watch
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a new Wear OS watch for over a year. I research all the time, and look what is happening in the industry. I was disappointed that this watch used the older Snapdragon 2100 instead of the new 3100. However, it works very well. I have seen a few stutters, but not like what I was experiencing with my 3-year-old LG Urbane watch, which I had upgraded to Wear OS 2.0. I love the look of this watch, and I the black shine looks wonderful. I purchased a black stainless steel band to go with it and it looks amazing! I highly recommend this watch!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Spend money on a better brand and pay for extended warranties ?
customer_reviews.text: 1st one received December 2018, failed, got really hot and failed. Sent back. 2nd one replaced within 30days and today is 08-15-2019 and the watch is dead. Battery wouldn't last longer than half a day and got worse and worse. Now nothing works dead...once in a while if I leave watch out over night and try different chargers I get the lightning bolt sign and nothing no screen no power .. I am in Arizona lol, maybe it can't handle the heat being on my wrist ? Sucks so much money and time ...🙄
customer_reviews.author: Victor Banuelos

customer_reviews.title: Biggest watch I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch, and I think I made a good choice in purchasing it, but the thing is HUGE. The biggest issue I have is that every single time I bend my wrist back, it pushes on the buttons. The buttons could be smaller, the watch could be smaller. Or, the buttons could have been located on the left side of the watch face instead of the right. Also, the watch band is kind of short. If it was just a centimeter longer it would fit a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Nedd

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Alright so to start off the watch looks fairly nice the feel however seems low grade and as if it's made from plastic. Wear os makes this thing feel pretty laggy with that ancient processor there's no excuse for that I mean was it not tested?? The part that killed me is that the charger seems to no longer work and it's only been a few days. Customer service is offering to send a new one but thats about 3 to 5 days to be shipped out to me (what an inconvenience). UPDATE : Customer was helpful and responsive. Help solved the problem quickly!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandro Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and stylish
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my Pebble in November 2018. I love it and it's stylish. The battery holds up to 2-3 days which is more than most smartwatches. Recently developed an issue with charging and the seller is super nice and sent me a charging dock to see if that was the issue, I think it maybe the watch itself so I'll contact them again. Full points for amazing customer service. Will be updating the review once I get the issue solved!
customer_reviews.author: Shivansh Singh

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if you want to use it with your iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of the looks of my Apple watches so when I saw this great looking watch I bought it. After 4.5 months I still like the looks but since I have an iPhone XR, now I wear this watch as a normal watch not as a smart watch. For me, the worst part is the Bluetooth connection drops all the time. Hence no notifications. :( [Above was before I started using a Pixel a3] Now the watch is connected to the Android phone. No more issue! Problem was with the XR.
customer_reviews.author: Vei Chiang

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great battery
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wear os watch. The battery is awesome, no issues getting 2 - 3 days +25 simple mode. The design quality is great the ability for the watch to fall back into simple watch mode is am awesome feature. The latest wear os update 2.1 made some improvements to the UI. I have had the watch for a month now and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Messenger

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much everything you could ask for
customer_reviews.text: Previous to this I had a ticwatch S, so I had an idea of what I was getting into, but this watch is amazing. The look and feel are top notch, then when you add in the features, you're looking at a watch that is a strong contender for best out there. The customization options are endless. Battery life is certainly better than most, and once you've got everything to your liking, then the battery life increases. I've recommended this watch to many people. Will continue to be my watch choice.
customer_reviews.author: The_Rainmaker

customer_reviews.title: Tic Toc I think not!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my first SmartWatch and overall, was disappointed. The display is not as crisp as I thought it should be, the battery was horrible, even after I stopped playing with the watch every second and I'm a Samsung fanatic and it wouldn't work with Samsung Pay or Galaxy Store. Even though Google App offerings are way more, that along with the other issues caused me to return it. I ultimately went with the Samsung Watch 46 mm and couldn't be happier! Tic Pro may be for you, but wasn't what I envisioned.
customer_reviews.author: JimBear

customer_reviews.title: Not my kind of bang.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very nice and stable. However is not adequate for my lifestyle; I can't be charging a watch every night because I like to track my sleep. There much more watches out there that will live for over 4 days; this one does one day without much push. It does not have a native sleep tracker. Pros: It is very responsive and of good craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: EOS

customer_reviews.title: What a Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Pro Model mainly for it's battery life. When l received the watch I charged it for hours. I then programmed the watch so as to consume the least amount of battery power possible. I tracked the power consumption, and to my distress the battery life is no where the manufacturer claims it to be. I really like the watch, but for a manufacturer to fabricate false information on their product is extremely disconcerting.. Why is Amazon not involved in policing their advertisers on their web site.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Baehr

customer_reviews.title: Not half bad, for a half good watch.
customer_reviews.text: My experience with the Ticwatchpro. So far it's been a alright experience, there are some neat features, however I wasn't really wowed by this watch. I wish it was closer to what my ideal smartwatch would be, but as my first smartwatch I must say it isn't halfbad at all. I should add that I didn't use the sleep tracking, because I don't like wearing it to bed. Pros: fits comfortably, I do love the dual layered screens, the battery life is also very good and it feels well built. Cons: low amount of storage, can't view full (Storage or Ram) on watch, must use phone and it doesn't support many apps offline.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life leaves something to long for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after seeing several reviews that raved about the battery life on these watches. I was very disappointed after giving this a shot myself. Typically, I didn't get even a day's use out of the watch before it died. I wasn't using it for anything extra, either. I would typically only use it for notifications for my phone and then the step monitor. Because this didn't have the battery life I was hoping for, I will be returning the product and going back to my samsung gear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality smart watch.
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch. I have an iPhone and it connects easily. Going in I knew my texts would not transfer, however, calls do go through to the watch. Battery life is as advertised. Good quality materials. Lots of functionality. Only issue I had was with the OS which is done by Google (Wear OS) when they updated and changed where to adjust settings, change the watch face, etc. Great watch! I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great. Could use a backlight.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my previous Wear OS watch, the battery life on this one is amazing. It handles all the chores with adequate responsiveness. The 'essential mode' would be even better if there was a backlight to see the time when in the dark. I highly recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: R.E.D. III

customer_reviews.title: just spend the extra money on the Apple Watch or galaxy watch.
customer_reviews.text: Mobvoi app is annoying, and some features require you to use it. Battery life is great because of the second screen. If you have an iPhone get the Apple Watch, find a used one or something. If you have android, just buy a Samsung watch. A day after I got it I wished I spent the extra money. Steps on lcd screen require you to use mobvoi app, which sucks. Google fit on the phone and Google fit on the watch showed wildly different things, every day. It got messages and stuff well enough. But if you’ve owned and Apple Watch or galaxy watch don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff LaMontagne

customer_reviews.title: too heavy and large
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a very nice smartwatch but it was way too heavy on my wrist. After wearing 2 days in a row my wrist was super painful. I left it off the following day and by evening my wrist was fine again. It would probably be fine for a man, especially a large-boned person but too much for most women I think. I've returned it and am trying another smaller watch now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this watch.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch so far. Well worth the extra money for all the features it has. Can have tons of apps, integrated well with my Google pixel 2, and has been working well. I've drained the battery pretty fast but I've been messing with it all day so I'm sure it will last longer when I'm not on my watch most of the day. Step count is very accurate and the apps work well on the phone and watch.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Plsek

customer_reviews.title: Good watch and good service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch 9 months ago and it worked very well. The battery life was good for my use and could be significantly increased when using the essential mode. The apps worked well and the watch is more comfortable than my apple watch. After 9 months, the watch became stuck in a boot loop. I contacted service and they quickly replaced the watch. The fact that it crashed at 9 months would normally have driven my evaluation lower but the quick response of the service department and replacement of the watch brough the evaluation back up. I will also note that my son has the same watch and has had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, but don't expect more than a day out of the battery
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, professional watchfaces and all the functionality you could want out of a smartwatch. But the only way you're going to get the claimed 5 days out of the battery is if you leave the unit off. Also, the "background" watchfaces are often so dim that they are useless though I found one that you can actually see the hands. You'll have to experiment a little to find one that works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Willner

customer_reviews.title: Setup isn't that easy
customer_reviews.text: Updated. I found nowhere any mention in the setup about needing a low voltage power supply. I had both watches plugged into a multi USB plug and that was converting the low voltage output from the PC to high voltage. My son has one of these watchs and found the problem. We are up and going now.
customer_reviews.author: Argyle G Milner

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this watch!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this watch in December 2018 as a Christmas present for myself. I was initially impressed with the claimed 2-3 days battery life and 30 days in essential mode. The battery never lasted more than a day on full charge from the moment I got it. After 2 months its now bricked. Simply won't charge or power on. When placed in the charging cradle the battery icon flashes briefly showing 50% and then the screen goes blank. I've tried various power outlets and still no difference. Great waste of money🤬🤬🤬🤬
customer_reviews.author: Placd1

customer_reviews.title: Love the look, feel and functionality, needs major software polishing.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: battery life, over all design/build quality, the dual screen concept, features( NFC, WiFi, Bluetooth). Dislikes- delayed handover from LCD screen to main screen, no additional features or watch faces for the LCD screen, software needs to smoother on transitions from app to app, watch band that came with watch is awfully cheap.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Consistently inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: The watch looked great, and the battery life, when used in smart mode was really good. I really liked the watch, but it would never consistently work well. Sometimes I could answer calls, sometimes I couldn't, sometimes the GPS would work sometimes it wouldn't, sometimes the App downloads okay sometimes it wouldn't, that's the whole watch or nutshell. When it worked it was good when it didn't it was bad at $250 it should work all the time
customer_reviews.author: ultimatelawman

product_meta.title: TicWatch Pro Bluetooth Smart Watch, Layered Display, NFC Payment, Google Assistant, Wear OS by Google (Formerly Android Wear),Compatible with iPhone and Android (Black)
feature_bullets: LONG BATTERY LIFE: 2-30 days on a single charge is achieved by dual layered technology and two modes. Smart Mode will get you 2-days of battery life and Essential Mode will achieve 30-days of battery life. If Auto Switch to Essential Mode is turned on, then 5-days of battery life will be achieved. WARNING:Please charge from a computer USB port or with a 5V 1A USB power adapter, please avoid any 2.1A fast charging or the charger will be fried.
SMART MODE: Wear OS by Google, AMOLED display, Google Assistant, thousands of apps and watch faces through Google Play store, health & fitness tracking
ESSENTIAL MODE: Power saving FSTN LCD display, high sunlight visibility, shows essential information including time / date / step counter / heart rate

HEALTH & FITNESS TRACKING: GPS tracker, heart-rate monitor, step counter, calories burned counter, speed & cadence monitor. NFC PAYMENTS: Use Google Pay to purchase directly from your wrist at millions of places without fumbling around for your wallet.

SMART SLEEP TRACKING: Download TicSleep app on the watch and check your sleep progress via mobvoi app on the phone. There is 30-day money-back guarantee for any reason, 12-month warranty for quality-related issues. MobvoiUS is the sole authorized seller of authentic Mobvoi products (other than Amazon) on the Amazon platform.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars2,624 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
